Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: hook maeander band at rim above dot and billet frieze; below, painted decoration consisting of goat to right (part of horn remaining); pendant triangle and concentric circles ringed with inverted TT as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, not by the Painter of the bowl, because it displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments albeit similar to those on the bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 74, p. 238, no. 194)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0369) (phase 2)
